items.title: Rangers hold off M's; 2 back of Wild Card
items.summary: The Rangers struck early and held on for a 5-3 victory over the Mariners in the first of a four-game series at Globe Life Park on Monday night. The Rangers, who led 4-1 after two innings, are now two games behind the idle Twins in the race for the second Wild Card spot in the American League.
items.content: The Rangers struck early and held on for a 5-3 victory over the Mariners in the first of a four-game series at Globe Life Park on Monday night. The Rangers, who led 4-1 after two innings, are now two games behind the idle Twins in the race for the second Wild Card spot in the American League.

alternate.title: Rangers hold off M's; 2 back of Wild Card

items.title: Brault, Bucs slow Brewers' postseason push
items.summary: Steven Brault and the Pirates spoiled what was supposed to be a happy homecoming for the Brewers, who fell flat in a 7-0 loss to Pittsburgh on Monday in their return from a weekend sweep of division-leading Chicago.
items.content: Steven Brault and the Pirates spoiled what was supposed to be a happy homecoming for the Brewers, who fell flat in a 7-0 loss to Pittsburgh on Monday in their return from a weekend sweep of division-leading Chicago.

alternate.title: Brault, Bucs slow Brewers' postseason push

items.title: Freeland exits after being struck by line drive
items.summary: Rockies rookie left-handed starter Kyle Freeland was removed from Monday night's game against the D-backs after a sizzling line drive from JD Martinez hit him in the neck-shoulder area on the left side, in the back.
items.content: Rockies rookie left-handed starter Kyle Freeland was removed from Monday night's game against the D-backs after a sizzling line drive from JD Martinez hit him in the neck-shoulder area on the left side, in the back.

alternate.title: Freeland exits after being struck by line drive

items.title: 2002 A's react to Indians' impressive streak
items.summary: Take it from Scott Hatteberg, a man who knows exactly what it takes to win 20 in a row.
items.content: Take it from Scott Hatteberg, a man who knows exactly what it takes to win 20 in a row.

alternate.title: 2002 A's react to Indians' impressive streak
